documentation.para: The figures are taken from the latest CIA world factbook. Each country has information giving it's name, region within the world, population, GDP (in millions of US dollars) and the age and gender distribution of the population.
Some countries will have no GDP figures and some may have no population figures (where this is no indigent population). The CIA definition of a country is relatively liberal.

The ranges within the age distribution are percentages. The total is the percentage of the population within that range. The male and female attributes give the percentage of that particular range for each gender.

country.name: Saint Helena, Ascension, and Tristan da Cunha
United States Pacific Island Wildlife Refuges
South Georgia and South Sandwich Islands
